bug.author: Bigwode
bug.summary: A bug appear in samples in notebooks
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1.run migrating_from_torchvision_to_albumentations.ipynb
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader trainloader = DataLoader(torchvision_dataset, batch_size=1, shuffle=True, num_workers=1) for i, (image, label) in enumerate(trainloader): print(i, (image.shape, label)) add these lines of code, and we can find that image.shape = torch.Size([1, 224, 224, 3]), but pytorch needs the inputs.shape=[1, 3,224, 224] <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Albumentations version (e.g., 0.1.8): Python version (e.g., 3.7): OS (e.g., Linux): How you installed albumentations (conda, pip, source): Any other relevant information:
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>

comments.comment:
You need to transform from numpy array to the torch tensor. The way to do it is: <denchmark-code>from albumentations.pytorch.functional import img_to_tensor </denchmark-code>
and within a DataLoader to cast img_to_tensor operation to the augmented image. <denchmark-code>...
return img_to_tensor(image), label </denchmark-code>
I updated the notebook in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/albumentations-team/albumentations/pull/208>#208</denchmark-link>
